law.text: The Kentucky Infrastructure Authority is created solely to perform essential governmental functions and to serve the public purpose of engaging in a program of assistance to governmental agencies in the state with respect to the construction and acquisition of infrastructure projects. In accomplishing such purposes, the Kentucky Infrastructure Authority shall be and constitute a de jure municipal corporation and political subdivision of the state.
law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 124, sec. 4, effective March 31, 1988. -- Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 216, sec. 11, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 204, sec. 1.
